FuncDef:
The dhcpv6 option-priority radius domain pool command configures the highest, medium, and lowest priorities for the DHCPv6 Option delivered by the RADIUS server, configured in the domain view, and configured in the address pool view, respectively.
The undo dhcpv6 option-priority radius domain pool command restores the default configuration.
By default, the DHCPv6 Option configured in the address pool view has the highest priority, the DHCPv6 Option delivered by the RADIUS server has the medium priority, and the DHCPv6 Option configured in the domain view has the lowest priority.
CLIs: undo dhcpv6 option-priority radius domain pool
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the DHCPv6 Option is configured in the domain view and in the address pool view and delivered by the RADIUS server, you can run the dhcpv6 option-priority command to configure priorities for the DHCPv6 Option.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
